citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The IACUC has not completed a review of the facility's program for humane care and use of animals within the last six
months. IACUC records reviewed during this inspection indicate that IACUC semi-annual reviews of the facility’s program
for the care and use of animals last occurred in August of 2022. Regular reviews are necessary to ensure IACUC
oversight of the program and to ensure the welfare of the animals being used in research by the facility. With respect to
activities involving animals, the IACUC shall review at least once every 6 months, the research facility’s program for
humane care and use of animals. Correct by ensuring the IACUC reviews the facility's program for humane care and use
of animals at least once every six months. Correct by July 21, 2023.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The IACUC has not completed an inspection of the animal facilities within the last six months. IACUC records reviewed
indicate that IACUC semi-annual inspections of the animal facilities last occurred in August of 2022. Regular inspections
are necessary to ensure IACUC oversight of the facility and to ensure the welfare of the animals being used in research
by the facility. With respect to activities involving animals, the IACUC shall inspect at least once every six months, all of
the research facility’s animal facilities, including animal study areas. Correct by ensuring the IACUC inspects the animal
facilities at least once every six months. Correct by July 21, 2023.

The written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) for dogs has not been updated to reflect the directions of the current
attending veterinarian. The facility has an agreement with a veterinarian, however, the PVC has not been reviewed and
signed by the individual. Failure to maintain a documented and signed PVC can result in a lack of understanding and
direction in the general health and care of the animals. A written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) for dogs must be
established and maintained so that the facility has a current plan that provides for adequate preventative care and
treatments as deemed necessary. The plan must include all required components as listed in the Animal Welfare Act and
Animal Welfare Regulations, Part 3, Subpart A, Section 3.13. Correct by July 5, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Jonathan Tomkovitch, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
